title: sfpowerkit DX Project File
description: The properties and shape of the SFDX project enhanced for sfpowerkit

packageDirectories.title: Package Directories
packageDirectories.description: Package directories indicate which directories to target when syncing source to and from the scratch org. These directories can contain source from your managed package, unmanaged package, or unpackaged source, for example, ant tool or change set.
packageDirectories.$comment: The properties ancestorId & ancestorVersion cannot be included together, but this schema optimizes for VS Code code completion rather than pure validation.

name.title: name
name.description: The name of your Salesforce project.

namespace.title: Namespace
namespace.description: The global namespace that is used with a package. The namespace must be registered with an org that is associated with your Dev Hub org. This namespace is assigned to scratch orgs created with the org:create command. If you’re creating an unlocked package, you have the option to create a package with no namespace.

sourceApiVersion.title: Source API Version
sourceApiVersion.description: The API version that the source is compatible with. The default is the same version as the Salesforce CLI.

sfdcLoginUrl.title: SFDC Login URL
sfdcLoginUrl.description: The login URL that the force:auth commands use. If not specified, the default is login.salesforce.com. Override the default value if you want users to authorize to a specific Salesforce instance. For example, if you want to authorize into a sandbox org, set this parameter to test.salesforce.com.

signupTargetLoginUrl.description: The url that is used when creating new scratch orgs. This is typically only used for testing prerelease environments.

oauthLocalPort.description: By default, the OAuth port is 1717. However, change this port if this port is already in use, and you plan to create a connected app in your Dev Hub org to support JWT-based authorization.

plugins.title: CLI Plugins custom settings
plugins.description: Salesforce CLI plugin configurations used with this project.

packageAliases.title: Aliases for packaging ids
packageAliases.description: The Salesforce CLI updates this file with the aliases when you create a package or package version. You can also manually update this section for existing packages or package versions. You can use the alias instead of the cryptic package ID when running CLI force:package commands.

packageDirectory.path.title: Path
packageDirectory.path.description: If you don’t specify a path, the Salesforce CLI uses a placeholder when you create a package.

packageDirectory.default.title: Default
packageDirectory.default.description: If you have specified more than one path, include this parameter for the default path to indicate which is the default package directory.

packageDirectory.package.title: Package Identifier
packageDirectory.package.description: The package name you specified when creating the package.

packageDirectory.versionName.title: Version Name
packageDirectory.versionName.description: If not specified, the CLI uses versionNumber as the version name.

packageDirectory.versionDescription.title: Version Description
packageDirectory.versionDescription.description: Human readable version information, format not specified.

packageDirectory.versionNumber.title: Version Number
packageDirectory.versionNumber.description: Version numbers are formatted as major.minor.patch.build. For example, 1.2.1.8.

packageDirectory.definitionFile.title: Definition File
packageDirectory.definitionFile.description: Reference an external .json file to specify the features and org preferences required for the metadata of your package, such as the scratch org definition.

packageDirectory.dependencies.description: To specify dependencies for 2GP within the same Dev Hub, use either the package version alias or a combination of the package name and the version number.

packageDirectory.ancestorId.title: Ancestor ID
packageDirectory.ancestorId.description: The ancestor that’s the immediate parent of the version that you’re creating. The package version ID to supply starts with '05i'.

packageDirectory.ancestorVersion.title: Ancestor Version
packageDirectory.ancestorVersion.description: The ancestor that’s the immediate parent of the version that you’re creating. The ancestor version uses the format major.minor.patch.build.

packageDirectory.includeProfileUserLicen.title: Include Profile User Licenses
packageDirectory.includeProfileUserLicen.description: Whether to include <userLicense> elements in profile metadata

packageDirectory.apexTestAccess.title: Apex Test Access
packageDirectory.apexTestAccess.description: Additional access that should be granted to the user when running package Apex tests

permissionSets.title: Permission Sets
permissionSets.description: The list of permission sets to enable while running Apex tests

oneOf.title: Permission Set String
oneOf.description: The list of permission set to enable while running Apex tests as a string

oneOf.title: Permission Set Array
oneOf.description: The list of permission set to enable while running Apex tests as an array

items.title: Permission Set Name
items.description: Name of the permission set to enable while running Apex tests

permissionSetLicenses.title: Permission Set License
permissionSetLicenses.description: The list of permission sets licenses to enable while running Apex tests

oneOf.title: Permission Set Licenses String
oneOf.description: The list of permission set licenses to enable while running Apex tests as a string

oneOf.title: Permission Set Licenses Array
oneOf.description: The list of permission set licenses to enable while running Apex tests as an array

items.title: Permission Set Licenses Developer Name
items.description: Name of the permission set to enable while running Apex tests

packageDirectory.aliasfy.title: Aliasfy the package
packageDirectory.aliasfy.description: Deploy a subfolder in a source package that matches the alias of the org

packageDirectory.alwaysDeploy.title: Always deploy the package
packageDirectory.alwaysDeploy.description: Deploys package, even if it's installed already in the org. The artifact has to be present in the artifact directory for this particular option to work

packageDirectory.assignPermSetsPreDeploy.title: Apply Perm Sets Pre Deployment
packageDirectory.assignPermSetsPreDeploy.description: Apply permsets before deploying a package

packageDirectory.assignPermSetsPostDeplo.title: Apply Perm Sets Post Deployment
packageDirectory.assignPermSetsPostDeplo.description: Apply permsets after deploying a package

packageDirectory.buildCollection.title: Build Packages in a Collection
packageDirectory.buildCollection.description: Utilize this to build packages in unison, it will build all packages in the collection, even if only one of them changes

packageDirectory.isOptimizedDeployment.title: Use optimized deployment
packageDirectory.isOptimizedDeployment.description: Detects test classes in a source package automatically and utilize it to deploy the provided package

packageDirectory.ignoreOnStage.title: Ignore this package on a stage
packageDirectory.ignoreOnStage.description: Ignore this package on any provided stage

packageDirectory.postDeploymentScript.title: PostDeployment Script
packageDirectory.postDeploymentScript.description: Run an executable script after deploying a package. User need to provide a path to the script file

packageDirectory.preDeploymentScript.title: PreDeployment Script
packageDirectory.preDeploymentScript.description: Run an executable script before deploying a package. User need to provide a path to the script file

packageDirectory.reconcileProfiles.title: Reconcile Profiles
packageDirectory.reconcileProfiles.description: Reconcile Profiles during a deployment of source packages

packageDirectory.type.title: Type of the Package
packageDirectory.type.description: Denotes the type of the package,  accepted values are "source","data"

packageDirectory.skipCoverageValidation.title: Skip Test Coverage Validation
packageDirectory.skipCoverageValidation.description: Skip the coverage validation of a package (unlocked/source)

packageDirectory.skipDeployOnOrgs.title: Skip Deployment of the Package
packageDirectory.skipDeployOnOrgs.description: Skip deployment on a particular org or org(s). Take an array of aliases as the input

packageDirectory.skipTesting.title: Skip Unit testing
packageDirectory.skipTesting.description: Skip unit testing during validate or deployment (source packages)

packageDirectory.checkpointForPrepare.title: Is an Checkpoint Package?
packageDirectory.checkpointForPrepare.description: Fail the scratch org,if the any of the checkpoint package fails to deploy on prepare

ignoreFiles.title: Ignore Files
ignoreFiles.description: Map of stages to forceignore filepaths

prepare.title: Prepare stage
prepare.description: Path to forceignore for prepare stage

validate.title: Validate stage
validate.description: Path to forceignore for validate stage

quickbuild.title: Quickbuild stage
quickbuild.description: Path to forceignore for quickbuild stage

build.title: Build stage
build.description: Path to forceignore for build stage
